title: Taurus Woman: Personality Traits & Romantic Compatibility

steps.title: Resilient
steps.content: Resilient A Taurus woman can juggle a lot of stressful things on her plate at once. During these tough times, though, she won’t bend or break—her friends and family might not even know how much she’s handling at one time. [1] X Research source For instance, a Taurus woman might keep quiet about her struggles and personal challenges rather than vent to a friend about them.

steps.title: Self-reliant
steps.content: Self-reliant Taurus women have no problem setting their own course in life. While she won’t refuse a helping hand, she’s more than happy to complete her to-do list entirely on her own. With that being said, a Taurus woman has no issue taking a step back in her own relationship and letting her partner call the shots sometimes. A Taurus woman might not ask for help with a big task around her home, like cleaning out the garage or tackling a home renovation project.

steps.title: Sensual
steps.content: Sensual The Taurus sign is ruled by Venus, the planet that reigns over both love and money. [2] X Research source So, it’s no surprise that a Taurus woman is deeply rooted in what she can feel, touch, and physically experience. As astrologist Stina Garbis puts it, “Being ruled by Venus brings out a highly sensual and physically affectionate side of Taurus that is very tactile.” Taurus women really thrive in the bedroom, especially when it comes to the physical aspects of sex. Anything that revolves around touch is up her alley, including (but not limited to) cuddling and massage. She has no problem taking her time when things get steamy! [3] X Research source

steps.title: Materialistic
steps.content: Materialistic As a sensual sign, a Taurus woman loves to indulge in beautiful things. As astrologer Stina Garbis describes it, she “enjoys luxury, the best of everything, and having luxurious houses filled with velvet, satin, lots of pillows, and fine art.” Influenced by the planet Venus and its sway over all things involving love and money, a Taurus woman has no problem adding fancy and luxurious touches to aspects of her daily life, like the food she eats and the clothing she wears. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Beauty-loving
steps.content: Beauty-loving Ruled by Venus, it’s only natural that a Taurus woman loves to stop and appreciate the beauty and majesty of the world around her. She’s more than content spending her day on a gorgeous nature hike, or heading to an art exhibit with her friends. If she’s in the same space as other beautiful sights and scenes, a Taurus woman is bound to be in her element. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Grounded
steps.content: Grounded True to her sign’s element (earth), a Taurus woman isn’t one to get caught daydreaming or stuck with her head in the clouds. She’s present in the here and now, and is ready to tackle any new challenge that life may throw at her. [6] X Research source For instance, instead of dreaming about becoming a famous singer, a Taurus woman would put time into practicing and strengthening her vocal skills.

steps.title: Committed
steps.content: Committed When it comes to relationships, a Taurus woman is in it for the long haul. She isn’t interested in casual hook-ups or flings; whenever she gives her heart away, it’s to someone she wants to be with for the rest of her life. The same principle applies to her friendships, too—she’s loyal to a fault and will support her friends for life. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Design-oriented
steps.content: Design-oriented Taurus women tend to gravitate to careers that revolve around design, like fashion or architecture. They tend to thrive in fields where they can be immersed in beauty—and, most importantly, where they can create and introduce new types of beauty into the world. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Nurturing
steps.content: Nurturing Taurus women are known for being excellent parents and are great at creating a variety of physical memories with their children. Think blanket forts, storytime, and delicious home-cooked meals—such experiences are the cornerstone of a Taurus woman’s parenting style. As a personal lover of routine, a Taurus woman makes sure that her household runs on a sense of structure. [9] X Research source A Taurus woman likely indulges in plenty of tactile holiday traditions, like taking her kids to a corn maze or decorating the Christmas tree with her family.

steps.title: Patient
steps.content: Patient Some people believe that Taurus individuals have two different modes for their brain—one where they’re relaxed and happy, and the other where they’re jazzed up and about to follow a new idea. [10] X Research source When they’re not approaching a new goal with an excited spirit, they’re going through life with a patient and chill attitude, content to stay where they are.

steps.title: Responsible
steps.content: Responsible As an earth element, Taurus women naturally tend to be on the more responsible side. [11] X Research source She’s the type of girl in class who always has her assignments completed days before the deadline, or who shows up to work 30 minutes early to ensure everything’s ready to go ahead of time. Hardly anything probably takes her by surprise since she’s always so on top of things.

steps.title: Dependable
steps.content: Dependable Need a shoulder to cry on, or a person to cover your shift? A Taurus woman definitely has your back, considering how dependable this zodiac sign is known to be. [12] X Research source Whether it’s a small request or a huge favor, a Taurus woman has no problem offering her assistance and helping you in whichever way you need.

steps.title: Stubborn
steps.content: Stubborn Just like her patron sign (the bull), a Taurus woman isn’t afraid to stand her ground and lock horns with someone she disagrees with. She isn’t being stubborn for the heck of it, though—as a Taurus, she has a strong moral code and set of beliefs that she won’t easily budge from. Although it isn’t easy, a Taurus woman may change her mind if she’s faced with solid logic. [13] X Research source Taurus is a fixed sign—in other words, it occurs in the middle of a season (spring). [14] X Research source Fixed signs are known for being especially determined and even stubborn, so it makes sense that these traits would translate to a Taurus woman. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Most compatible: Virgo, Capricorn, Taurus, Pisces, and Cancer
steps.content: Most compatible: Virgo, Capricorn, Taurus, Pisces, and Cancer According to astrologist Stina Garbis, “Taurus is compatible with other earth signs, Virgo and Capricorn, as well as with Pisces and Cancer .” Earth sign-based relationships (like Taurus-Taurus, Taurus-Virgo , and Taurus-Capricorn ) are rooted in mutual self-improvement, stability, and commitment, and are definitely compatible in the long term. [16] X Research source In a Taurus-Cancer relationship , a Taurus woman will admire how highly Cancer prioritizes their home and family. [17] X Research source In a Taurus-Pisces relationship , a Taurus woman may like how easy it is to communicate with her Pisces partner in so few words. [18] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 1031 wikiHow readers which trait they believe Virgos find most attractive, and 56% said intelligence . [Take Poll] So, if you're a Taurus woman looking to swoon a Virgo, show off your smarts!

steps.title: Moderately compatible: Scorpio and Libra
steps.content: Moderately compatible: Scorpio and Libra Astrologist Stina Garbis points out that a Taurus “may be drawn to their opposite match, Scorpio.” Scorpio and Taurus have the potential to create a really deep and profound emotional connection, which can lead to a long-lasting relationship. [19] X Research source Garbis also highlights how a Taurus “may find that they have a lot in common with Libra, who shares the same ruler, Venus.” Like Taurus, Libra individuals really have an eye for beauty and can prioritize the more luxurious things in life. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Least compatible: Aries, Gemini, Leo, Sagittarius, and Aquarius
steps.content: Least compatible: Aries, Gemini, Leo, Sagittarius, and Aquarius Earth signs like Taurus aren’t as naturally compatible with most fire and air signs, like Aries , Gemini , Leo , Sagittarius , and Aquarius . When it comes to air signs (like Gemini or Aquarius ), teamwork is key to a successful partnership, since the grounded and stubborn Taurus may not be comfortable with an air sign’s more fleeting and spontaneous nature. For a fire sign (like Aries , Leo , or Sagittarius ) and Taurus pairing, some arguments could be on the horizon—but it shouldn’t be difficult to talk things out and get into one another’s good graces again. [21] X Research source
